_header: As I gan wander in an evening / Between the corns
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 183.
Subjects: advice, to prelates; clergy, criticism/satire of
_description: Advice to Prelates — six 8-line stanzas, with refrain, ‘To kepe ther shepe well in fold’

OxfBal354.First Lines:
As I gan wandre in on evynyngBetwen the cornys be syde a
                    balke…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…I dare no more say lest I were shentBut I rede you kepe well
                    Christis fold
OxfBal354.Facsimiles:
Early Manuscripts at Oxford University: Facsimile

         (http://image.ox.ac.uk/show?collection=balliol&manuscript=ms354).
